H0.text: Thermal properties are the most important property architects must consider when selecting materials for the walls, ceilings, and floors of a new concert hall.

H1.text: Chemical properties are the most important property architects must consider when selecting materials for the walls, ceilings, and floors of a new concert hall.

H2.text: Electrical properties are the most important property that architects must consider when selecting materials for the walls, ceilings, and floors of a new concert hall.

H3.text: Acoustical properties are the most important property architects must consider when selecting materials for the walls, ceilings, and floors of a new concert hall.

A4.text: Excessive reverberation time can lead to poor speech intelligibility.

A5.text: Fabric covered panels are one way to heighten acoustical absorption.
